Opta Definition: Any pass attempted from one player to another — free kicks, corners, throw-ins, goal kicks, and goal assists.
Attempted pass made to a player who is in an offside position.
Attempted dribble past an opponent. Excludes when a player overruns the ball.
A foul is committed resulting in a free kick.
Ball goes out of play for a throw-in or goal kick.
Ball goes out of play for a corner kick.

Dispossesses an opponent of the ball. When outcome_id = 1, this means the tackle was won and possession was retained; when outcome_id = 0, this means the tackle was won but possession was not retained.
When a player intercepts any pass event between opposition players and prevents the ball reaching its target. Not a clearance.
Unforced error leading to a loss of possession. In recent seasons, this has been replaced with an unsuccessful ball touch event and overrun qualifier.
Goalkeeper event, saving a shot on goal. Can also be an outfield player event with the blocked column = TRUE.
Goalkeeper event, catching a crossed ball.
Player under pressure hits ball clear of the defensive zone or/and out of play.
Any shot on goal which goes wide or over the goal.
Whenever the ball hits the frame of the goal.
Shot saved. This event is for the player who took the shot. Blocked shots represented with the blocked column = TRUE.
All goals.
Bookings. These will have a red, yellow, or second yellow qualifier, and sometimes an associated reason.
Player is substituted off.
Player comes on as a substitute.
Player is forced to leave the pitch due to injury and the team have no substitutions left.
Player comes back on the pitch.
When an outfield player has to replace the goalkeeper.
Goalkeeper becomes an outfield player.
Change in playing conditions.
Referee or linesman is replaced.
Used when there is a stoppage in play such as a player injury.
Used when the stoppage ends and play resumes.
End of a match period.
Start of a match period.
Team line up. The involved, player_position, jersey_number, team_formation, and team_player_formation will show line up and formation details. These are reshaped in the formations table.
Player moved to a different position but the team formation remained the same.
Player is forced to change jersey number.
An event with event_id = 30 signals the end of a half. This signals end of the match and thus data collection.
Team alters its formation.
Goalkeeper event, ball is punched clear.
A player shows a good piece of skill on the ball, such as a step over or turn on the ball.
Aerial duel — a 50/50 when the ball is in the air.
When a player fails to win the ball as an opponent successfully dribbles past them.
This can occur post-match if the referee rescinds a card he has awarded.
When a player takes possession of a loose ball.
Player is successfully tackled and loses possession of the ball.
Mistake by player losing the ball. Leads to a shot or goal, as denoted by leading_to_attempt = TRUE or leading_to_goal = TRUE, respectively.
Goalkeeper event, picks up the ball.
Goalkeeper event, cross not successfully caught.
Goalkeeper event, comes out and covers the ball in the box winning possession.
Awarded to last defender when an offside decision is given against an attacker.
Defender uses his body to shield the ball from an opponent as it rolls out of play.
A throw-in not taken correctly, resulting in another throw-in awarded to the opposing team.
Goalkeeper event, penalty by opposition.
When keeper comes off his line and/or out of his box to clear the ball.
Used when a player does not actually make a shot on goal but was in a good position to score and only just missed receiving a pass.

Used when a player makes a bad touch on the ball and loses possession. When outcome_id = 1, this means the ball simply hit the player unintentionally; when outcome_id = 0, this means the player deliberately but unsuccessfully controlled the ball.
Match resumes on a new date after being abandoned mid-game.
Any major talking point or error made by the referee. Decision will be assigned to the relevant team.
Delay after referee stops play. This event is given to both teams on restart.
Injury time awarded by referee.
Denotes which attacking player was caught offside.
Similar to an interception, but the defending player is already very close to the ball.
Match start delayed.
Match ended early.
Indicates that a player is now off the pitch.

Derived using our g+ event-ordering methodology. Successful carries are included if their straight-line distance exceeds 5.5 yards. All unsuccessful carries (i.e., those with which possession is lost) are included.
